info.name: Whispir REST API
info.description:
**Whispir REST API Collection**

The Postman Whispir REST API collection is a fully parameterised system of API requests to assist developers in understanding the function and purpose of each of the Whispir API methods.

To use the API Collection, create an environment with the following variables.

_base-url_ - points to your api region https://api.au.whispir.com
_x-api-key_ - given to you by your Whispir admin
_whispir-username_ - given to you by your Whispir admin
_whispir-password_ - given to you by your Whispir admin


**Limitations**
Currently the collection only reports values in JSON

request.description:
All parameters are optional and not all combinations are valid.

Folders
Team
RSS
API Mapping
Asset
Instruction

Successful
Failed
Rejected

All parameters are optional and not all combinations are valid.

Free text parameters are 'contains' matched.

request.description:
Create a new resource in the current workspace.  Ensure you have executed _Workspace [id]_ prior to using this request.  This request builds a simple resource, base64 encoded with the following fields
* FirstName
* LastName
* Next Shift
* Location
* Day
* Start Time
* Run
* mobile
* email

Note that _mobile_ and _email_ are taken from the _test-sms_ and _test-email_ variables.  Also note that resources are not unique so each use of this request creates a new resource.

request.description:
Create a simple text template with parameters to be used in the bulk message test
* firstName
* lastName
* next_shift
* location
* day
* start_time

The template name is unique, so a timestamp is added to the template name to prevent the request from failing.

for use by other requests in the collection.

item.description: This is a custom collection based on an event definition in a specific workspace and environment.  The requests in this folder probably _won't_ work for you.

request.description:
To use this request, ensure you have:
_{{retrieveContacts}}_ from the desired workspace

This method will (GET) retrieve all the contacts in a given workspace and iteratively DELETE them all.  Add _action=deleteAll_ to remove the contact from all workspaces.

You can refine the set of contcats to delete by using selection parameters in the GET querystring

* sortOrder:asc
* sortFields:lastName,firstName,companyName
* firstName: A
* lastName: Z
* companyName:Example Inc
* fields:firstName,lastName,companyName

item.name: Verify
item.description: Sends a code to the recipient to verify a transaction.

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 200ms", function () {
// set this workspace as JSON blob into the workspace variable
// set each of the accessible methods into a named variable

request.description:
Prior to executing this collection of requests, ensure the following variables are configured:
* x-api-key - for header value
* whispir-username - BASIC auth credential
* whispir-password - BASIC auth credential

This request will return with a list of accessible methods at the global, default workspace.  These are not used in preference to the methods reported in the _workspace-name_ workspace retrieved in _Workspace [id]_

To use this request, set environment variable _workspace-name_ and use _GET Workspaces_ before this call.
